messages.subject: NEXT OF KIN
messages.body:
Dear Friend,


I am very sorry to interrupt your peace since you are not expecting to receive any mail from me. However, I was obliged to do so due to the need and urgency of the message. I crave your indulgence and want to reassure you that I mean well to you and that it is only for our mutual benefit. So please do not be embarrassed.

I sincerely write to seek your co-operation and trusts to enable me carry out an urgent business opportunity in my department. I am Mr. Jackson Paul, an account manager to Mr. E Wayne. Who died along with his family in the Asia Earth Quake Disaster (TSUNAMI DISASTER)http://www.cnn.com/SPECIALS/2004/tsunami.disaster/ All of his Family lost there lives in the Disaster. Since then I have made several inquiries to his Country embassy to locate any of my client's extended Relatives, this has proved unsuccessful. After these several unsuccessful attempts, I decided to contact the Nigeria Chambers and Commence were I got your contact.

My client was a successful and accomplished family man, who works with Shell Company here in Africa, He was sent to Asia (Sri Lanka) for a Special Assignment for his Company (Shell) were he died. He left in his domiciliary account a 40% of individual private deposit with our Bank, which I have with me the Investment Deposit Certificate an important
document worth Six Million United Stats Dollars (US$6 Million). Until date I still manage this Deposit will like to know you personally and then I will give every consent to the Bank here as knowing you and state in Court here declaring you as the next of kin to my late client.

I am contacting you to assist in repatriating the money left behind by my late client. The Bank will pay this money to you as an inheritance. After the sudden death of my client, and for the reason that there as has not been a next of kin to my late client, the bank has decided to forfeit the money and declare it as an abandoned property as there is no next of kin who should inherit his funds.

The board of directors of his bank adopted a resolution and I was mandated to provide his next of kin for the payment of this money within 28 working days or forfeit the money to thebank as an abandoned property. The bankers had planned to invoke the abandoned property decree of 1996 to confiscate the funds after the expiration of the period given to me.I have reasoned very professionally and I feel it will be legally proper to present you as the next of kin of my deceased client, so that you can be paid the funds left in his bank account. I therefore seek your consent to present you as the Next of Kin to my Deceased client so that the proceeds of this Bank Account valued at  Six Million United Stats Dollars (US$6 M) can be paid to you.

The need for a foreigner as next of kin in this project is occasioned by the fact that the customer was a foreigner and a Nigerian will not perfectly fit in as his next of kin or heir. I have agreed that a reasonable percentage of the Fund would be giving to you as foreign partner, thereafter I will meet you in your country for disbursement.

Please understand that my approach to you is based only on my positive reasoning and on the belief that you will not disappoint or betray me at last. The amount is fairly huge and we have agreed that on completion of the deal, you will be highly compensated for your assistance. An attorney will be contracted to help us revalidated and notarize  all the necessary legal documents that can be used to back up any claim you may make as soon as I hear from you with your full consent to present you to the Bank as the next of kin to my late client and after both of us reach an agreement.

All I require is your honest cooperation to enable us seeing this deal through. I guarantee that this will be executed under a legitimate arrangement that will protect you from any breach of the law. Please consider my official positions, reputation and integrity, especially, the opportunities in the business itself, it is very necessary that all due care be taken so that we do not miss the opportunity due to carelessness.

You are therefore expected and advised to display high degree of maturity, responsibility and understanding in handling this information. I will give you all the details in my next mail when you have indicated your interest and commitment to work with me. Always remember that this is the highest confidence and trust any person can repose on the other, especially when it is considered that we did not know ourselves before.

              I hope you will honor me too.

I will come over to join you in your Country for disbursement when the funds hit your account. More so for an effective and easy communication I will advice that you furnish me with your telephone and fax number.


  I await your response through my mail account;

          jackson_paul_2005@yahoo.co.uk

THANKS


Best Regards,

Mr. Jackson Paul.

messages.subject: WAY FORWARD
messages.body:
Dear pedro,

Thanks for your mail and your resolve to work with me
in realizes this project.

In this project I will present you as the next of kin
to the deceased person consequently all application
for the release of the funds will be made to your
nominated bank account. As you will provide the bank
protection and stand as next of kin to the deceased
person and beneficiary to the funds.

After all application by the lawyer I will contact
here to defend the claim to represent you in the
defense of the claim and stand as the lawyer to the
deceased person and executor of the will.

After transfer we shall share as stipulated in my
first letter though I will re-invest my share in your
country as I intend to go into a formal investment
agreement with you so as to confer on you the right to
invest and manage my funds for me after we have
entered into comprehensive investment agreement
relationship. Please note very well 35% for you 60%
for me while 5% is set aside to cover all expenses,
you know if the funds is transferred there will be
bank charges, the bank will take there charges and
some taxes will be paid and when it comes over to your
country too your bank will also take some charges and
your country will tax the money somehow, this is why I
earmarked out the 5% and from there also whatever we
expended on the project will be refunded to us, any
incidental expenses you and me insured will be
refunded including phone bills etc.

Please send me;

1.Your direct phone.

2.Your mobile number

3.Fax number including your office or home Address

With the above mentioned information I will look for a
lawyer that will secure the document that will present
you as the rightful next of kin.

And i will also send to you the text application form.
for you to fill and send it to the bank for more
confermation.

Also for constant communication as you know that this
project needs constant communication.

Thanks as I await your urgent reply.

Yours truly,

Mr. Jackson Paul.

messages.body:
Dear Mr. Jackson Paul

I am glad to hear back from you.  I was afraid that your offer was too
good to be true, and you might leave me hanging over the plate.

I am on the road for my job a lot, so I don't have access to a fax
machine.  I'm sure you can scan anything you need to send me.  You can
reach me at 206.202.1619.  If I don't answer, leave a message and I
will call you back.  Email is always the easiest however.

Please, Mr. Jackson Paul, could you send me a copy of your
international passport so I can be sure of your identity?   I wouldn't
like it if you were trying to put me in a squeeze play.

Best Regards-
Mr. Pedro Martinez
messages.raw:
Pedro Martinez

Date: Aug 15, 2005

Yours Truly,
Pedro Martinez

messages.body:
Cc: jackson paul <jackson_paul_2005@yahoo.co.uk>

Dear Barrister:

I need the following, as I am the brother of the late Mr. E Wayne,
client of Mr. Jackson Paul.  We were separated at birth; he grew up in

Dear Mr. October:

We have a BIG PROBLEM.  That Barrister told me that it would be $1500
for the documents.  I feel that is a completely reasonable amount to
charge for the procurement of documents!

Then, that spitball throwing bat corking shark sends me an invoice for
$9000!!  You don't need me to tell you, my friend, that is insanity.

We need to fire him and hire Superagent Scott Boras!  He'll help us
get your money.  Just give me the word, Mr. October, and I'll make the
call.

If you don't like that idea, maybe I could come to your country to
handle this in person.  I have a long stretch of time off coming soon
(no thanks to Gerald "Ice" Williams...)

Your friend,
Petey
messages.raw:
[Some background... Gerald 'Ice' Williams. He played for the Tampa Bay Devil Rays in 2000. In retaliation for something, Pedro plunked him in the first inning. Ice then charged the mound starting a bench clearing brawl. Pedro, enraged, then proceeded to take a no hitter into the ninth inning. One of the best pitching performances I have ever seen. Fast forward to 2005. Both Pedro and Gerald are on the Mets. Pedro has a no hitter going into the ninth. Fly ball into the outfield, Williams is going for it... and he misses it, wrecking the no hitter! Karma? Who knows. Lets take it out on Barrister Galvin.]

Pedro Martinez

messages.body:
Dear Mr. October:

I can't understand your email.  And I told you I'm not impressed with
this Barrister.  I think he is cut rate, unprofessional and I cannot
in good faith do business with him.  He would get cut from Single-A
camp on the first day, tossing his 60mph fastballs.

So my friend, we have 2 choices.

1.  You find a competent Barrister.  There must be another in Nigeria
who has more skill than your overpaid whiny batboy.

2.  I get Superagent Scott Boras to handle this.  I'm not joking, my
good friend, when I tell you that this man can get ANYTHING done.

As far as Barrister Galvin, I say we give him a Don Zimmer - One hand
on each ear and a faceplant into the infield.

Your friend,
Petey

messages.body:
Dear Mr. October:

I don't like to see you this upset, my friend!  You're so upset I
could hardly understand your email.

Mr October, what happened to the strong confident man I started this
transaction with?  Now you're wheedling to an EMPLOYEE.  Barrister
Galvin doesn't run Nigeria.  He's not a bank official.  He's a lawyer.

There's no way I will ever tell him I am sorry.  You should know me by
now - I am a vary stubborn and proud man, and I don't take well to
disrespect.  I left Boston because of it, and  I'll probably leave New
York some day because of it.

So, either we get a new lawyer and you get your act together, or we
part company.  And Pedro holds grudges.

Your friend,
Petey

Usted aspira los huevos,
PETEY
